PKGLINT(1) General Commands Manual PKGLINT(1)

NAME

pkglint — detect common mistakes and stylistic issues in pkgsrc package definitions

SYNOPSIS

pkglint [-dijsw] [pkgsrcdir ...]

pkglint [-v]

pkglint [-h]

DESCRIPTION

The pkglint utility runs a series of checks on one or more pkgsrc directories to detect common mistakes and stylistic issues in package source. pkglint follows the requirements of Pkgfile(5) manual page, but also contains additional checks.

The options are as follows:

-d, --dead-links
Check “Pkgfile” and “README” files for dead links.
-i, --invalid
Check “.footprint” file for invalid directories, like /usr/local, /usr/share/locale, /usr/share/doc, /usr/share/info, etc.
-j, --junk
Check “.footprint” file for junk files, like “README”, “TODO”, “NEWS”, etc.
-s, --suid-sgid
Check “.footprint” file for SUID/SGID files and directories.
-w, --world-writeable
Check “.footprint” file for world-writeable files and directories.
-v, --version
Print version and exit.
-h, --help
Print help and exit.

EXIT STATUS

0 if success, >0 otherwise.

SEE ALSO

finddeps-linked(1), findredundantdeps(1)

September 3, 2023 Zeppe-Lin
